name: Kim Heirston
bio: Post-War & Contemporary Art Advisor. World Traveller. Yale Alum.

social_posts.post_text:
I just finished reading a book called BIG MAGIC by Elizabeth Gilbert @elizabeth_gilbert_writer - you know the author of EAT PRAY LOVE.

I loved her more recent book which is all about daring to live creatively, Julie, you could have been a chapter in the book. I have always admired your fierceness. Whether it is a silver-themed party, a Barbie bash or a leather and lace Bacchanalia, you always create BIG MAGIC!

I am so proud of your entrepreneurial spirit….. and to call you my friend. Happy Birthday. Thank you Billy @wmacklowe. Happy Holidays to all!

#themacklowewhiskey #bigmagic #elizabethgilbert #musica #bobmoses #entrepreneur #leatherandlace #bacchanalia #birthday #holidayseason #creativity

Last Wednesday, I spent the entire day at Yale @yale, first meeting with the Director of the YUAG @yaleartgallery, Stephanie Wiles. Thank you for the awesome walk down memory lane, I practically lived at the Art Gallery between classes and studying. 

It was wonderful to visit old friends like Van Gogh’s THE NIGHT CAFE, one of my favorite Frankenthalers, ISLAND WEATHER II, and the glorious tangerine and lavender Rothko, 1954. I’m so excited about a few new acquisitions - especially by Kehinde Wiley @kehindewiley and Wangechi Mutu @wangechistudio. Kerry James Marshall’s @kerryjamesmarshs 2009 painting is one of the greatest I’ve ever seen. Well done Yale!

During the afternoon, I hung out at the new Schwarzman Center @yale_schwarzman. While I go back to Yale with some regularity, it has been a long time since I have been in The Rotunda, a space which is at once old, and sparkling new. 

The Commons looked like The Commons only way better! I arrived around 2:30, and the hall was totally abuzz. The jumbo screens lent the place a big stadium feel. I touched down just in time to see France score against Morocco. The whole room erupted in cheers!

I had always thought (and heard) the food at Yale was pretty good. In the 80’s, we had salad bars, which seemed highly enlightened at the time. Now, there is full Danny Meyer style hospitality. The Elm, Ivy and Well are pretty incredible too. 

I loved the Dance Studio, the Cupola Dome and The Bow Wow. However, it was the Wellness corridor that really made my spirits soar! 

Jennifer @chuchifrito, thank you for the dynamic and thoughtful tour. I left the YSC euphoric….. and wanting very much to go back to school!

#yale #yaleuniversity #yaleuniversityartgallery #yuag #yalealumni #modernart #contemporaryart #antiquities #stephaniewiles #sollewitt #streethall #vangogh #thenightcafe #helenfrankenthaeler #markrothko #kehindewiley #kerryjamesmarshall #sheilahicks #tituskaphar #olgadeamaral #martinpuryear #elanatsui #theschwarzmancenter #therotunda #thecommons #france #morocco #thewell #wellness #meditation

Hello from Lamu!

I have always dreamed of visiting this magical island.  Thank you, Julian and Coco for making it a reality!  The first 24 hours have been amazing!  Can’t wait for what’s in store….

#lamu #kenya #shela #magicalplace #dream #africa #outofafrica

On Lamu, New Years Day is the occasion for the annual dhow racing festival.  It’s a bit St. Barths’ bucket regatta meets the Sydney to Hobart race, except the ancient Arab sailing vessels are much slower.  The intense colors, pageantry and fierce competition reminded me of the Sienese Palio. 

Many spectators rent speed boats to follow the action.  I was advised that the best way to experience the event was to begin at the Peponi Hotel where everyone congregates.  We then migrated to a private beach house to take in the spectacle from the thatched  terrace.  This was followed by a delicious luncheon of snapper, with a chili salsa verde, roasted potatoes and a most tantalizing papaya salad! 

What an amazing day!  Thank you, dear Julian, for the exquisite hospitality!

#lamu #kenya #shela #islandlife #indianocean #sailing #dhow #regatta #bucketrace #stbarths #sydneytohobart #palio

Did a little shopping today…💙

#lamu #shela #shopping

#sailing #sunset #dhow #indianocean #lamu #kenya

This is my last day in Lamu…Missing her already…

I have safaried extensively in South Africa - through Kruger, Botswana and Namibia. My first expedition, over 20 years ago, I remember it taking several days to see the Big Five. Today in the Mara, I saw four of these magnificent creatures - elephants, buffalo, lions, and a most extraordinary solitary leopard. We also witnessed adorable sleeping cheetahs, not to mention gazillions of gazelles, zebras, and a few majestic giraffes. Being amongst these awe-inspiring animals still manages to take my breath away.

Tomorrow I head to Tanzania!

#safari #themara #masaimara #masaimaranationalreserve #kenya #bigfive #elephant #buffalo #lion #leopard #cheetah #zebra #gazelle #giraffe #ostrich #crocodile #hippo #hotairballoon

#ThrowbackThursday to my visit to Korogocho, one of several slums in Nairobi, including Kibera (check out Nicholas Kristof’s @nickkristof excellent article in yesterday’s #NYT). Home to almost 200,000 people, in Swahili, Korogocho means “crowded-shoulder-to-shoulder.” I found the neighborhood exhilarating, never at once feeling in danger. I loved the private enterprises - from hair salons to pool table vendors to “investment” shops specializing in real estate. Residents were fashionable and beautiful, particularly against the backdrop of dazzling signage and kaleidoscopic graffiti murals. 

First off, KHub was utterly thrilling. Our tour guide Daniel @oluochdaniel led us through the facility, which provides resources like online classes, photography, and film production. The space lets local artists come together, collaborate and grow. I was really impressed by the filmmaker, Ken @qenitomwoya. Wow! His short film was compelling and visually stunning. Then, I was blown away by the street art photographer Ian @ianhaileys. His work captures the profoundly vibrant, buzzing essence of Koch. I also connected with producers Victor @odhiambo_ke and Charles @njugunacharlaw, technology undergrads Pauline @polarpauline and Loureen @odhiamboloureenachi, scholarship alumnus Stephen @edger_photography, and songstress Sharon @_liboi_. Passion, creativity, artistry, and heart abounds at this remarkable institution! 

Later, we dropped in on the unforgettable Ufanisi Center, which gives vulnerable children basic education, food, and clothing. The students there are eco-friendly trailblazers! The youth and environmental protection project works with kids of young, single mothers to make their homes and schools greener by recycling waste from the nearby Dandora Dumpsite as well as conserving water supplies. 

The day came to a close with a soul-stirring performance of WE ARE THE DIFFERENCE by Mara, Nairobi’s Amanda Gorman. Mara is a star! If anyone has any ideas on how to help launch her spoken word career, please DM me! 

I can’t thank Be Kids Australia, Isaiah @isaiahluyara, Richard @revanspictures, and Joan Peters enough for an extraordinarily meaningful experience.

It is calving season in the Serengeti.  Here the wildebeest give birth to their little  ones during the tail end of the rainy season and as they begin to migrate north.

Today we came within about 10 minutes of catching the birth of a baby wildebeest. Each day, while watching  it the migration, I have loved watching the connection between  so many a mother and child. Both attached as if by invisible wire, her head gently arching in the direction of her child:

Babies are not only smaller but they are much lighter in color - more the shade of a gazelle or deer, than the coffee brown black of its  elders. The kids scamper about as moms keep a very watchful eye.

Later the same day, I observed a mothers heartbreak as her little one served as a chetahs’s  brunch. The whole seen was horrifying, heart wrenching, adrenaline-fueled, mysterious and magical.  What a day! 

Thank you, Jacob, for bringing me this magical kingdom…

#serengeti #migration #wildebeest #motherhood #mothernature #cycleoflife #thekill

Hello from the Rift Valley…Wifi has been very spotty which is why I haven't been posting. However, I wanted to share my time at the out-of-this-world Mwiba Lodge which is located on the border of the Serengeti. 

We arrived at this secluded paradise via the Lake Manyara Airstrip, on a pocket-sized plane with breathtaking views of the Rift Valley and Ngorongoro Crater. The airport lounge was like none other - think the Flintstones meets Noguchi.

There, I felt like I had stepped into a treetop haven, surrounded by cascading waterfalls, ancient boulders, natural springs where the resident wildlife quench their thirst, and birds called weavers (I learned that the males were busy making nests - sometimes two or three at at once - for the females to select which pad she thinks is the poshest). The elegant, minimal rooms each boasted wraparound tents plus binoculars to take it all in. 

The Nyasi Migrational Camp, where I spent two nights, was an excellent rotating site for yet more spectacular safariing. I managed to catch the beginnings of the Great Migration as well as calving season. The abundance of fresh grass along the Arugusinyai River is the perfect feeding spot for the majestic wildebeest and their young to graze before continuing on North to the next phase of their long, ancestral journey. 

The sensational staff gave me a warm sendoff with a moving rendition of a song from the Lion King. I adored my stay at this magical place!

#tanzania #mwiba #mwibalodge #sunrise #theserengeti #riftvalley #ngorongorocrater #nyasimigrationalcamp #safari #thegreatmigration #wildebeest #lion #giraffe #mwibaairport #mwibaairportlounge #lakemanyara #arugusinyairiver #thelionking #weavers

As my East African journey winds down, I took thee weekend to spend some time in the Ngorongoro Crater.

The fist day was desert, the second all oasis.  This place is like nothing I have ever experienced….

#ngorongorocrater #olduvaigorge #shiftingsands #rhino #buffalo

Goodbye 

I can honestly say this is one of my favorite journeys… up there with my first time to India and the Galapagos.

Lamu was a perfect start to the New Year, with its low-key glamour, and chic parties.  Nairobi was all hustle (no reference to the current president) and bustle and art.  Safari in the Mara, the Serengeti, and the Crater were experiences so unique it is hard to lump them into one category - the Mara magnificent, the Serengeti wild and free, while the Crater and its natural containment felt more prehistoric, with a touch of Disneyland.  What really impressed me was Olduvai Gorge (where Mary Leakey made her discoveries) and the excellent newish museum that makes crystal clear the complex story of man’s evolution.

However, it was the RVCV that captured my heart like nothing before…. Founded in 2004 by India Howell, known as Mama India, the center cares for over 100 children ranging from babies to toddlers to college age and about to be brides. India is equal parts Karen Blixen, Katherine Hepburn, and Mother Theresa.  She also happens to be a LI girl! At the village, each child knows that they are safe and cared for.

Thank you to Laetitia @laetitiago for recommending I go to this beautiful, inspiring, marvelously-run space. 

I will miss all of the staff, and the volunteers, but mostly the kids. This place has altered me forever. 

#tanzania #riftvalley #riftvalleychildrensvillage #rvcv #tanzanianchildrensfund #tcf #indiahowell #gyetighiprimaryschool #oleandiprimaryschool #oleandisecondaryschool #binoculars #dressup #costumes #nurse #fireman #astronaut #herecomesthesun #thebeatles

I arrived from Tanzania caked in African dust…

Less than 24 hours later my very personal glam squad waved their magic wands…And Just Like That, I was transformed. Shout out to @andreawilson_hair, thank you for coming down to Florida to tame my unruly locks. My fairy godmother Angie @vivalacortes.services, I appreciate your willingness to do my makeup on such short notice. Sending love to my other angels Tatiana and Julia. 

What a dazzling evening at the Norton @nortonmuseumofart celebrating A PERSONAL VIEW ON HIGH FASHION & STREET STYLE: PHOTOGRAPHS FROM THE NICOLA ERNI COLLECTION. This Swiss collector has amassed a trove of ultra-glamorous images by Richard Avedon, Arthur Elgort, Cindy Sherman, Inez & Vinoodh, Tyler Mitchell, and Nadine Ijewere to name a very few. The candy colored walls, dreamy lighting, and vibrant floral arrangements made for an enchanting evening. 

The band was awesome; I danced the night away - leaving just before the stroke of midnight! 

#nortonmuseumofart  #gala #palmbeach #transformation #glamsquad #andjustlikethat #nicolaerni #nicolaernicollection #richardavedon #arthurelgort #cindysherman #inezvindooh #nadineijewere #highfashion #fashionphotography #photography #dance #cinderella

#FlashbackFriday 

One of the first things I did, during a world-wind 24 hours in NYC earlier this month, was to head to Gagosian for the very excellent exhibition of paintings by Cy Gavin.

Born in 1985, Gavin was raised 20 miles outside of Pittsburg, in a steel and coal mining town called Donora, Pennsylvania. He graduated from Carnegie Mellon University in 2007, and completed his MFA at Columbia in 2016 - two very prestigious schools. The artist now lives and works upstate.

Gavin’s central themes include the exploration of identity, race, and memory. His monumental landscapes reference the artist’s Afro-Caribbean ancestry and American upbringing, as well as contested histories in places he has lived and traveled. For the artist, the natural world acts as an analog for these topics - more recently portraying colorfully abstracted versions of barren trees or invasive flowers observed at his home in Dutchess County.

In 2016, Cy completed a six-month residency at Miami’s esteemed Rubell Museum, where he created a suite of works that drew inspiration from his time visiting Bermuda, the homeland of his father and a place the artist has often visited to conduct research on his family’s history. He was also included in the group exhibition at the museum, entitled HIGH ANXIETY, which took place the same year. 

In addition to a solo exhibition at the Aspen Art Museum, Gavin has been included in exhibitions at the MASS MOCA, The Whitney Museum of American Art, and Callicoon Fine Arts. His work is in the collections of the Fondation Louis Vuitton, the Studio Museum in Carmen, The Whitney Museum of Art, the Carnegie Museum of Art and the National Gallery of Canada. 

#cygavin #gagoisan #gagosiangallery #chelsea #rubellmuseum #massmoca #thewhitney #aspenartmuseum #newyork #nyc #art #landscape #landscapepainting #abstraction #nature #gallery #artadvisor #artadvisory #kimheirstonartadvisory

Our entire team is very pleased to be included in the Financial Times WHO’S WHO of top international Art-Advisors. After 30 years in the the business, I am honored to still be making these Top 10 lists! 

I am so grateful to my staff, particularly our long-term director, @sharonralaghband. Shout out to Claudine, Olivia, John, CK, CH, JP, as well as interns past and present.  So appreciative of our extraordinary clients for their patronage. Congratulations to my colleagues and peers!

Thank you to @financialtimes. I look forward to participating in the FTWeekend Festival @ft_weekend on May 20th in Washington DC. Stay tuned for more information…

Helen Frankenthaler and Marilyn Minter in the same room… I think I’m in heaven!

💙💙💙
 
What a beautiful evening at the Gagosian celebrating the exhibition opening of HELEN FRANKENTHALER, DRAWING WITHIN NATURE: PAINTINGS FROM THE 1990s!

Over the course of the 1980s, highly painterly canvases became her principal pictorial means, resulting in what would be her final decade, canvases of the greatest dramatic scale and impact.

There are lyrical passages, sharing the field with muscular strokes. These paintings are knock-out!

For everyone who has thought of Helen’s work as “soft,” this exhibition will utterly change your mindset!

The opening was capped by a lovely dinner which was mixed with champions, friends, and family of Helen’s. I was honored to be a part of this magical night.

Thank you, Gagosian and Jason Ysenburg.
 
#throwbackthursday #helenfrankenthaler #gagosian #marilynminter #colorfield #colorfieldpainting #davidbowie #soundandvision #electricblue #turquoise #blue #drawingwithinnature #chelsea

Sad to be leaving Palm Beach but excited for New York!

Some of the highlights of my stay included my dear friend, Kimberly Paige Bluhm’s wedding bash, John and Alina’s Villa Eau de Vie soiree, Easter with the Thompsons, Whiffenpoof’s luncheon at The Everglades Club, The Breakers Cancer Luncheon, a very special birthday party at the Carriage house, The Heart Ball, The Old Bags Luncheon with the fabulous Liz Mcdermott, The Race of Hope, Peggy Siegal & Katherine Bryan’s BERNSTEIN’S WALL screening, and lastly, I was proud to host a back to back dinner and luncheon honoring India Howell, founder of the Rift Valley Children’s Village in Tanzania. Thank you to all those who supported the organization. If you would like more information about how to donate, keep in touch, or volunteer with RVCV, visit www.tanzanianchildrensfund.org

What a whirlwind three weeks in NYC…Love don’t get no higher than this

Auction previews, Frieze and TEFAF, along with an awesome lineup of major museum exhibitions including Cecily Brown at the Met (5x), Wangechi Mutu at the New Museum (3x) and Peter Brant’s THIRTY ARE BETTER THAN ONE - an exhibition devoted to the work of Andy Warhol. 

I was thrilled to attend exhibitions and dinners for Kehinde Wiley: HAVANA at Sean Kelly, Richard Mayhew: NATURAL ORDER at Venus Over Manhattan (thank you, @Adamlindemann1 I loved hanging out with your mom). Lastly, there were two kick-ass David Zwirner exhibitions: Luc Tuymans: THE BARN and Yayoi Kusama: I SPEND EACH DAY EMBRACING FLOWERS. 🌺🌼🌹🌼🌺

I managed to squeeze in four broadway productions, three Galas, and one black tie birthday, as well! What a special evening celebrating John Loeb at the American Scandinavian Foundation. Dear Sharon, thank you for making me part of the family. The Viennese Opera Ball felt like a fairytale, thank you, @jannabullock. I loved celebrating your birthday with you too! Last was the Whitney Museum Gala, and a farewell to its departing director Adam Weinberg. Thank you, Neil and @Kpaige77 💜

Last but not least, I saw BONO at the Beacon Theatre. Thank you, @Revanspictures for that amazing experience.

#TEFAF #FRIEZE #Christies #Phillips #Sothebys #Basquiat #Cecilybrown #WangechiMutu #Thenewmuseum #Andywarhol #Kehindewiley #Richardmayhew #Luctuymans #Yayoikusama #Davidzwirner #Marilynminter #Basquiat #Camelot #Badcinderella #Primafacie #Kimberlyakimbo #Bono #Beyoncé #Renaissance

Dearest @jannabullock, thank you for the most beautiful birthday ever…
I am overwhelmed by your generosity, graciousness, and exquisite taste. The natural backdrop, the table setting, the cobalt Venetian glasses, the green cheetah-print table cloth, the fuchsia peonies, your cool Isabel Marant jeweled jeans, the Ibiza-inspired music, the lobster tails, and floral corn cobs, the divine pasta, your gorgeousness, and that of those you gathered……. A total visual feast. Thank you so much, dear friend. I love you! 💗

Thank you, @Nickcastoria for capturing the dream with your filmic photography!
You are outrageously talented. Well done!

@pbacchini @gengen96 @Alina.dealmeida @wulffpierre @gilles_bensimon

My highlights from Art Basel…

What a great way to start UNLIMITED with the spectacular pyrotechnics of Adel Abdessedmed’s JAM PROXIMUS ARDET, LA DERNIÈRE VIDÉO (2021).  Abdessedmed uses fire and water as symbolic elements to depict a powerful and transient entity, breaking traditional narrative structure to focus on a single shot: a burning ship on the horizon. As it approaches, the viewer discovers the presence of the artist on deck, seemingly unaffected by the chaos unfolding behind him.

On a more art historical front, I loved seeing the gorgeous sunny yellow Mark Rothko at the Acquavella booth. It exudes the ephemeral magic of daybreak in paint. Thank you @Leemindel for the great picture.

I also loved PARCOURS curated by @Samuel_leuenberger with outstanding paintings by Alexander Carver, Tanya Merrill and digital works by Petra Cortright and Laure Prouvost - fabulous! 

Thank you, @Gagosian and my dear friend @Deborahmcleod for the exquisite dinner at Drei Könige, @Davidgmaupin for the lovely evening at Chez Donati, and @Mariangoodmangallery. Shout out to Linda Pellegrini for a wonderful supper at Bottmingen Castle.

💛🧡💛

#ARTBASEL #UNLIMITED #PARCOURS #Adelabdessedmed #Augustasserapinas #Čiurlionisgym #Michelangelopistoletto #Markrothko #Keithharing #Christophevandeweghe #Simoneleigh #Carriemaeweems #Olafureliasson #Viviansuter #Alexandercarver #Tanyamerrill #Petracortright #Laureprouvost #Dreamingofnofronttears #Jimmyhendrix #Fire @Dougaitkenworkshop @galerieevapresenhuber @Aquavellagalleries

What a ravishing journey seeing David Hockney’s BIGGER & CLOSER (NOT SMALLER & FURTHER AWAY) immersive experience at @Lightroom. It is like floating in his work combined with extraordinary lessons in art history as well as personal insights. He talks about everything from developing a three point perspective in the renaissance, to the properties of photography, to embracing of all things tech related. What a trip he takes us on. Everything is the artist’s own words and voice.

We left the space floating on air…and color!

“The world is very very beautiful if you look at it, but most people don’t look very much. They scan the ground in front of them so they can walk, they don’t really look at things incredibly well, with an intensity. I do.”

-David Hockney

#Davidhockney #Biggerandcloser #Lightroom #Nicomuhly @David_Hockney @amy_hoadley

YOU SHINE A LITTLE LOVE ON MY LIFE most definitely reflects the way Mark feels about Sharon, and Sharon about Mark. It may also refer to the glorious Roman sun that made its appearance on the most important day. It certainly represents the feelings I have about my director for over a decade! 

Sharon, you shine love on everybody’s life. What awesomely beautiful moments you orchestrated. Your wedding was one of the most beautiful I have ever attended. I love you to the moon and back, as does everybody in the room - one of the many reasons the evening was so magical. 

🤍🌸🤍🌸🤍

@sharonalaghband @sharon.and.mark.rome #SharonandMark #VillaMiani #Rome #Eternalcity #Ido #Love #Togetherness #Wedding #Flashbackfriday #Youshinealittleloveonmylife #Electriclightorchestra

I am over-the-moon to be selected as one of the women on Forbes 50 Over 50 list. Thank you, Forbes, @Mikabrzezinski and Maggie McGrath!

So thrilled to share this honor with these awesome, powerhouse women. I read Viola Davis’ memoir FINDING ME and was blown away. I just caught Jamie Lee Curtis’ interview on the MORNING JOE lamenting the Fentanyl epidemic. I am so excited for Shiela Bridges and Shirin Neshat, Tonya Lewis Lee, Katie Couric, and Annie Leibovitz, whom I’ve met or gotten to know over the years. I grew up to the words of both Judy Blume and Patti LaBelle. Congratulations, to my fellow Forbes 50 over 50 sisters!

For the 16 years it has been in existence, I have been a faithful disciple of the MORNING JOE and a huge fan of Mika Brzezinski. What an amazing concept she has pioneered.

Lastly, thank you, Rita, for nominating me 🤍

You can view the full FORBES 50 Over 50 list here:

https://www.forbes.com/50over50/

@Forbes @ForbesWomen @KnowYourValue @Morningmika @Jamieleecurtis @tonyalewislee @harlemtoilegirl @Kristinhannahauthor @Judyblume4real @Violadavis @mspattilabelle @Shirin_neshat @Katiecouric @Melrobbins @Annieleibovitz @Jennifersalke @Tonyalewislee #Carolynanonson #Mickylawler #Areyoutheregod?itsmemargaret #Forbesover50 #Forbes #50over50 #Honored #Forbessisters #Womanofforbes #Knowyourvalue #Areyoutheregoditsmemargret

Filled with pride over Guild Hall’s stunning renovation, and our Gala last Friday evening! To celebrate Renée Cox, whom I have known for over the 30 years, and Leo Villareal, whom I have known almost as long, made for an awesome art double-header!

Renée Cox’s A PROOF OF BEING is a selection of her most celebrated and important photographs from 1993 to present. The avatars Cox creates are variably historical figures, art history tropes, cosmopolitan socialites, and Afro-centric superheroes - all imbued with sexual agency and resolute confidence. Thank you for the amazing private tour of the show which, for me, was like walking down a memory lane of our friendship! Your mesmerizing video is a tour de force. I am so proud of you, dear friend.

Leo Villareal’s CELESTIAL GARDEN features his new monumental LED light sculpture, accompanied by a soundscape and artist-designed furniture. Villareal’s abstract compositions, inspired by nature’s intricate patterns, unfold in real-time and envelop the viewer in a dynamic interplay of light and sound where space and time intertwine. The glorious light bath conjures all things cosmological, spiritual, technological and psychedelic. It’s like floating through the cosmos on acid! Well done, my Burning Man Brother!

Congrats to my new bestie, honoree Ken Wyse. Andrea, you looked looked like a movie star! Yvonne, my art world sister, I love you! Cuatro, my fellow Yalie, thank you for taking such a beautiful photo of me and your mom. DJ Mick, you are the joint!

P.S Shout out to Barbie whose spirit I channeled for the evening!

💗💗💗

@guild_hall @Reneecoxstudio @Leo_villareal @wysekenneth @gentleridevan @yvonneforce @Cuatrovillareal @Tinamarieclark @Jannabullock @Simonelevinson @Kathyprounis @Jessicadalenephotography @Patrickmcmullen @dualipa

#Guildhall #Guildhallgala #Gala #Renéecox #Aproofofbeing #Photographs #Leovillareal #Celestialgarden #Lightsculpture #DJMick #Barbie #Dualipa #Dancethenight

The last thing I wanted to do was to leave The Hamptons on a beautiful Labor Day weekend…

However, I am so glad I did! I have never been more warmly and graciously welcomed than I was in Seoul. 

Dear @Susanshin88, thank you for forcing the issue! It was so much fun hanging out with @Simondepury and Princess Alia Al- Senussi. 

My time in Seoul kicked off with the second ever @Frieze Seoul in the COEX Convention Center. Its wood paneled interior lent the fair an unusual warmth. 

I so enjoyed sharing the fair with you, Sungjoo. I also loved seeing your sister, Youngjoo’s work at the W-Space. 

The first full day concluded with the @WWDKorea Art Gala whose mission is to raise awareness and funds to support global creative communities and to celebrate the rich spirit of art in Korea. The room was filled to the brim with talent. Yuna Kim, thank you for hosting such a vibrant event - it was so beautiful and off-the-charts fun. A big congratulations to the winner, Joghwan Lee! 

Highlights from my trip include a fantastic multi-media installation of 16 large-scale artworks at the LUX: Poetic Resolution show at the Dongdaemun Design Plaza designed by Zaha Hadid. The show was curated by my new friend, Jiyoon Lee. 

I also loved visiting all the amazing galleries -many transplants from New York including @Gladstone.gallery, @Perrotingallery, @thaddaeusropac , @Lehmannmaupin, and @Pacegallery. Of course, there are the Seoul staples: @PKMgallery, @Galleryhyundai and @Kukjegallery.

It was so much fun spending an afternoon visiting art spaces with @David_Salle and Emily and hearing David’s lecture at the Hyundai Card Library later that evening. 

Last but not least, I had the chance to receive the most amazing K-Beauty treatment at @Shangpree.official : a luxurious marine jewel facial containing salmon DNA - it was intoxicating, my cells were drunk with moisture!

It feels so good to be back in NYC, taking in all the amazing art this city has to offer! Kicked off a mega gallery marathon with Daniel Arsham: 20 YEARS at @Perrotin. Renowned for visually transforming cultural objects into subtly eroding artifacts, Arsham showcases the power of nostalgia by conflating past, present, and future.

Next up was @Hauserwirth ’s staggering display of Louis Bourgeois’ inventive print works, created using old garments and household fabrics she had saved throughout her long life. The exhibition, entitled ONCE THERE WAS A MOTHER, are like pages pulled from a cloth diary with images of maternity - pregnancy, childbirth and breastfeeding - at the fore. You can see where Bourgeois identified with her mother, a tapestry weaver and restorer. She weaves together works that are intensely fueled by cathartic re-visitations of early childhood trauma and frank examinations of female sexuality.

Wolfgang Tillmans: FOLD ME at @Davidzwirner was a lyrical wunderkammer of images.  @Vitoschnabelgallery group exhibition entitled THESE DAYS featuring Cecily Brown, Francesco Clemente, Pat Steir, Lola Montes, and David Salle included an electric array of paintings with apocalyptic scenes.

At @Kasmingallery was Bosco Sodi: SOLO PARA REVIVIR. Sodi’s deepening investigations into the symbolic power of four elemental colors—black, purple, red, and green—are expressed in several large-scale mixed media paintings imbued with impressions of nature: indented with the fractal structure of tree branches drawn from the surroundings of the artist’s studio, or subjected to the pull of gravity as they dry.

The Ashley Bickerton show at @Gagosian was a bittersweet experience. As a fixture on the 80’s and 90’s scene, I knew Ashley and spent a lot of time in his presence along with other members of the Sonnabend tribe. Seeing some of his early works, which I grew to love, are mixed with his rather eerie, more recent blur paintings. We miss you, Ashley.

Caption continued in the comments...

After Coachella, I didn’t think seeing Beyoncé could get any higher. And in some respects it did not. But in others, like that deep core of self awareness and knowledge that only the right book, or film or song can bite down and draw out of you. That’s what RENAISSANCE was for me.

Seeing the show in New Orleans - the city of Katrina, jazz, and ghosts lent a unique aura to the experience. We relished our historical tour that morning. Thanks to our local sax- playing legend, Quay.

Song highlights for me: I CARE, AMERICA HAS A PROBLEM, ALL UP IN YOUR MIND, PLASTIC OFF THE SOFA, COZY, and BREAK MY SOUL. For visuals alone, I thought the backdrop to CHURCH GIRL was awesome with its stained glass, rosary windows - an evocation of a gothic cathedral, perhaps Notre-Dame. When Bey sang ALL UP IN MY MIND I loved the the red-light district aura, and the barely there unitard that made her seem nude (she was not), and slightly vulnerable. Then the flesh-toned sparkling bodysuit, with elongated black sequined hands surreally and strategically placed over her body in all the right spots - Schiaparelli meets Dali. So fabulous. Janna was googling the designer between sets. FYI it’s by Jonathan Anderson of LOEWE. The best part was Bey’s impersonation of Botticelli’s BIRTH OF VENUS - a painting I never fail to visit if I am within 100 km of Florence’s Ufizzi Gallery. Her version of 21st century hyper luxe appropriation is awesome!

My vote for the most heart warming set came when Blue Ivy emerged on stage. The crowd went wild! True to her awesome DNA - just try to imagine having Beyoncé and Jay-Z as your mom and pop. No Pressure! She nailed it.

RENAISSANCE wasn’t just a concert for me. It’s about art, AI, cultural politics, fashion, space travel, spirituality, as well as a deep dive into identity. A week later, I find myself still thinking about so many moments that touched my soul...

Caption continues in the comments

#Throwbackthursday

I cannot believe two weeks ago FRIEZE celebrated its 20 year anniversary in London! Straight from the plane, I hit the ground running to see Georg Baselitz’s fabulous raw timber sculptures at the Serpentine South Gallery.

Later that day, I saw Richard Prince’s early photography (1977-1987). The exhibition featured many of Prince’s iconic cowboy, girlfriend, and advertisement photographs. Collecting, chronicling, and repurposing examples of discomfiting mainstream humor alongside images from a variety of mass media, Prince chronicles the intersection of America’s vernaculars and subcultures in the construction of its national identity. 

I was so proud to visit my dear friend Marina Abramović’s exhibition at the Royal Academy. The show highlights some of her enduring interests - the importance of public participation, pushing the limits of the body, drawing energy from nature and developing meaning through ritual. The exhibition presents key moments in her career through sculpture, video, installation and performances by next generation performance artists, trained in the Marina Abramović method. I am so very proud of you, Marina - congratulations! 

Another highlight was our annual ladies luncheon at 5 Hertford celebrating an art-filled week, followed by a grand tour of Anish Kapoor’s studio. Thank you, @Evamariaoneill for being such a wonderful co-host. 

Caption continues in the comments

I have a confession to make…I never, ever really liked Las Vegas. I don’t gamble, and I don’t drink. Except for Tracey Emin, neon has always made me nervous. 

That’s all changed now. It started with a really amazing stay and a double, actually triple, header Lady Gaga Anniversary Extravaganza in 2018, expertly orchestrated by you know who. 

Next was The Sphere, something that inspired in me the nearest thing to an actual craving that I had ever experienced. I was DYING to see this LED masterpiece! 

Then, of course, Formula 1! I became a fan about a decade ago when someone insisted that we get up at an un-godly hour one weekend morning to watch the races.Thank you, Richard @revanspictures. I have met @Lewishamilton, twice now, and genuinely think he is the coolest dude on the planet! 

When my buddies @Iampaulkanavos and @Dayssi.ok said they were hosting a viewing at their 63 Las Vegas complex, where we could watch the race from the 2nd floor glass atrium, a 3rd floor terrace, and the rooftop, I was ALL-IN! 

I can even call this get away a business trip as the F1 weekend coincided with the launch of a new media exhibition space. The ARTE MUSEUM, originated in Korea and is dedicated to immersive media art presented by D’strict. Here, you can lose yourself in an encounter with nature that goes beyond time and space through diverse artworks themed ETERNAL NATURE. 

There are so many amazing works of art throughout this city - like the permanent art installations by Richard Long, Nancy Rubin, and Jeff Koons.

The neon that I once found so disturbing, now feels awesome and vast - like nature. So, as Elvis Presley says…. VIVA LAS VEGAS!

Headed from Miami to Palm Beach to celebrate my friend, Audrey Gruss! Here she is power-standing in front of one of my favorite paintings by Helen Frankenthaler, HOMMAGE À M.L .

Audrey, I cannot tell you how much it has meant to me to work with you and Martin for nearly twenty years. During that period, we have spent so much time together looking at art - in such spectacular places. It has been a career highlight to help put together a beautiful and meaningful collection, one that spans several households. I have watched in astonishment how HDRF has grown into something so very meaningful - one that touches upon and improves the lives of many. Being in your presence has been a masterclass in taste, meticulous organization, and grace. You are more than a friend, you are a mentor. 

Somehow it all comes together in PALMER’s feature article entitled LOVE STORY. How amazing it was we could execute with such efficiency while you were in Palm Beach and I was in Paris. The result speaks to our communication by osmosis. Congratulations!

Thank you, @Stefanotonchi for this awesome collaboration. Thank you, @alfonsodrn for capturing the Gruss’ radiant Italian Renaissance home and the glam Audrey herself. Thank you, @Palmerpalmbeach

This year in Miami, my highlights were not so much experience in the actual art fair. They happened in the museums, homes of collectors, and a special, familial luncheon at a country club. 

Exhibitions of Charles Gaines at the ICA, Gary Simmons at the Perrez Art Museum, and a small installation within the Rubell museum infused so much meaning into this year’s Art Basel Miami week. 

Gaines has been at the forefront of introducing language and systems into artistic production for decades. He is widely known for his use of translating mechanisms to convert images and documents into numerical structures, musical notation, and other sign systems. 

Happening upon Gary Simmons at the Pérez Art Museum was nothing short of kismet. We had initially planned to arrive at 9:00 in the morning, instead we arrived at 11:00 - just in time to see Gary alone, amongst his works in the first floor of the gallery. Then, we learned that we had arrived just in time for a tour with the Studio Museum, hosted by its director, @Thelmagolden. PAMM’s director, @Franklinsirmans also joined for an astonishing conversation about their friendship and collaborations which goes back to the early 90’s. What a special context in which to view a spectacular exhibition.

Throwback Thursday #tbt❤️

Day 1: Accra

We, my cousin Kimberly and my niece Jordyn - arrived in Accra in the late afternoon. 

Our first stop was the Memorial Complex honoring Kwame Nkrumah.

We learned so much about this amazing and inspiring man -  the father of Ghanaian independence. In 1957, Nkrumah became the county’s first president.

Nkrumah was born in Nkroful, Ghana in 1909. He received education in America at Pennsylvania’s Lincoln University. Kwame was an activist student, organizing the African Students Association of America and Canada, becoming its president. Importantly, Nkrumah was a believer in Pan Africanism - that there was strength in unity, and desperately wanted a United States of Africa.

Nkumrah was very close to JFK. They first met in 1961 when Kennedy invited Nkrumah to Washington for talks. However, their relationship was complicated by the Cold War politics - he was also close with leaders from Cuba and Russia - Castro and Kruschev, respectively- which didn’t sit well with the US following Kennedy’s Assassination. Nkrumah served as an inspiration to Martin Luther King, who often looked to Nkrumah’s leadership as an example of nonviolent activism.

On New Years Eve, 1957, Nkumrah married an Egyptian woman named Fathia Nkruma. Together, they had three children (there was another from an earlier marriage). However, when Kwame was overthrown in Ghana’s first successful military coup d’état on February, 24 1966, Fathia had to take her children to Cairo, to be raised there while Kwame went into exile in and jointly ruled Guinea.

This great leader coined so many phrases: “We face neither East nor West: we face forward” and “Freedom is not something that one people can bestow on another as a gift. They claim it as their own and none can keep it from them.” However, our favorite is: “Forward ever backward never!” We loved this!

#Accra #Ghana #Africa #Kwamenkrumah #JFK #Martinlutherkingjr #MLK #WEBdubois #PanAfricanism #Unity #Independence #Memorial #forwardeverbackwardnever

Words simply fail…. We travelled roughly three hours from Accra along the Cape Coast road to experience castles - ones not associated with fairy tales….

Cape Coast Castle is one of the numerous fortresses that were once commercial forts or slave “castles.”

In 1653, the Swedish Africa Company constructed a timber fort there. Originally the centre for trade in timber and gold, the castle later became a significant post in the Atlantic Slave Trade.

St. George’s Castle, also known as Elmina, is another Ghanian slave castle and was primarily used to hold enslaved Africans before they were loaded onto ships bound for the Americas. Originally built by the Portuguese, Elmina changed hands many times. In 1637, the Dutch seized the fort from the Portuguese, and later, in 1642, took over all of Gold Coast. In 1872, the Gold Coast, including the Cape Coast Castle and Elmina, became a possession of the United Kingdom.

Somehow, the façade felt more claustrophobic and sinister, each window and portal rimmed in an unforgiving black, as if to underscore the points of no return. It was hard to reconcile the beauty of the seascapes with the horrors experienced. We prayed for our ancestors. It was an emotional day. It was a heavy day. I am still processing the pain…

Nevertheless, pieces of a puzzle seemed to have knotted themselves into place in my head.  I still have no idea from where my ancestor hailed. I have felt far more connected to the lands of East Africa.  So,  I wouldn’t call it closure, but a few holes were filled. Just not the one in my heart.🖤🖤🖤

By the way, our guide, Kwesi, who looks like Samuel L. Jackson, had taken Kamala Harris and her husband, Doug Emhoff during their visit
to the Cape Coast last year. In 2009, Kwesi also escorted the Obama family.

@kimberlyhoyle @jordynalexiiss

Day 3 was a day of architecture and art. We started off at the NUBUKE Foundation. Founded in 2006, the NUBUKE serves as a nexus for preserving, recording, and promoting contemporary arts and culture. Embracing an open layout, the concrete architectural marvel seamlessly weaves into its surroundings, creating a space where design and environment coalesce effortlessly. 

We spent a good part of the day at the offices of British Ghanaian architect David Adjaye, where we had a delicious vegan lunch with his beautiful wife, Ashley.

There are so many extraordinary projects on his table here in Ghana including several district hospitals and the National Cathedral….

Next up was an Adjaye-designed space for Dot.ateliers. This is the galley and residency spearheaded by Amoako Boafo in the Labrador District where Amoako grew up.

The space is more than an architectural marvel; it is a beacon of ecologically-responsive design and community engagement. With its iconic sawtooth roof, low carbon foot print, and a thoughtful layout housing a gallery bathed in natural light, this gem redefines sustainable possibilities all while crafting a space to nurture artistic expression in its community. 

Visiting with Amoako was inspiring. We saw astonishing works that he was completing for his next exhibition in New Mexico in February.  Thank you, Amoako, for sharing. Thank you, too, @Gagosian for organizing such an awesome day! Thank you, @adiki.iam for the studio tours 🤍

Almost forgot to mention my drive by of the National theater - a multi-functional venue with a design that resembles a ship. The theatre was designed by Cheng Taining and Ye Xiangfan in collaboration with Ghanaian professionals and completed construction in 1992. Exploring the intersection of culture and innovation, these spaces are a testament to the timeless dialogue between architecture and community.

Day 4:

Here with the legendary El Anatsui….

Celebrated as a wizard of transformation, the Ghanaian born sculptor has lived most of his professional life in Nigeria.  How lucky for Ghana, and for us that he has come back home.

Born in 1944, in the Volta region of the country, El Anatsui weaves metallic bottle caps into complex, malleable assemblage tapestries. Other materials - including wood, cassava graters, monumental mortars - either built up, or left as strange found objects. 

Anatsui’s style combines pure abstraction with local aesthetic traditions. Most of his creations take on different forms each time they are installed. In morphing to activate various spaces, they challenge long-held views of sculpture as something rigid and insistent. His choice of media reflects his interest in reuse and transformation, and his desire to connect to his native continent of Africa, while also transcending the limitations of place. 

I remember first being gobsmacked by the work at the 52nd Venice Biennale in an exhibition curated by the great Robert Storr. Before visiting El’s new studio here in Accra, I made a pilgrimage to see the artist’s 2019 exhibition at the Haus Der Kusnt in Munich. It was curator Okwui Enwezor’s last effort…

Sharing that memory with El was very special. So was sharing his very new studio… Welcome home!

Thank you, El.💛💛💛Thank you @Afia_owusu_afriyie for arranging such a spectacular visit.
